p: The route of infection also seems to be important, with an emphasis on conjunctival and intratracheal infection, in which rhesus had a detectable viral load days after inoculation, with weight loss for the animals. Despite the low number of animals studied (five, which were divided into three groups), the study indicates that the contact of the virus with the ocular mucosa can be an important route of infection (Deng, Bao, & Gao,Â 2020).
